Updated November     pm



A new analysis has revealed that Obamacare has saved consumers . billion in  as a result of limiting what insurance companies can spend on expenses unrelated to medical care according to the Los Angeles Times PERIOD

An estimated . billion alone came in rebates to consumers which were required because insurers exceeded their required limits PERIOD

Studies have shown that the Affordable Care Act also aided in this as it forced insurers to become more efficient by limiting administrative expenses PERIOD Some insurers passed savings directly to consumers by providing lower premiums and higher spending on medical care PERIOD

Important consumer benefits have appeared and administrative costs in the individual market have dropped in  states with insurers in  states spending relatively more of their customers premiums on medical care PERIOD

Those who received health insurance through employment saw fewer benefits as insurers believed they had already met requirements but some were made to pay rebates PERIOD

Consumer advocates continue to push health insurance companies to step up their regulation PERIOD
